came.AlignedDataPairÂ¶

class came.AlignedDataPair(features: Sequence[Union[scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix, numpy.ndarray]], ov_adjs: Sequence[Union[scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix, numpy.ndarray]], oo_adjs: Optional[Sequence[scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix]] = None, varnames_feat: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None, varnames_node: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None, obs_dfs: Optional[Sequence[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]] = None, var_dfs: Optional[Sequence[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]] = None, dataset_names: Sequence[str] = ('reference', 'query'), ntypes: Mapping[str, str] = {'o': 'cell', 'v': 'gene'}, etypes: Mapping[str, str] = {'oo': 'similar_to', 'ov': 'express', 'vo': 'expressed_by'}, make_graph: bool = True, **kwds)Â¶

(pair of dataset2 of the same species)

Parameters

  • features (a list or tuple of 2 feature matrices.) â common / aligned feratures, as node-features (for observations). shape: (n_obs1, n_features) and (n_obs2, n_features)

  • ov_adjs (a list or tuple of 2 (sparse) feature matrices.) â unaligned features, for making ov_adj. shape: (n_obs1, n_vnodes1) and (n_obs2, n_vnodes2)

  • varnames_feat (list-like) â names of variables that will be treated as node-features for observations

  • varnames_node (a name-lists, or one concatenated name-list.) â names of variables that will be treated as nodes.

  • obs_dfs â a list or tuple of 2 `pd.DataFrame`s

  • ntypes (dict) â

  • etypes (dict) â

  • **kwds â other key words for constructiong of the HeteroGraph

_featuresÂ¶
_ov_adjsÂ¶
NetsÂ¶

vv_adj: var-var adjacent matrix (e.g. gene-gene adjacent matrix) ov_adj: combined observation-by-variable adjacent matrix (e.g. cell-gene adjacent matrix) G: dgl.Heterograph

n_obs, n_obs1, n_obs2
n_vnodes, n_vnodes1, n_vnodes2

Examples

>>> DataPair([features1, features2],
...          [ov_adj1, ov_adj2],
...          varnames_feat = vars_feat,
...          varnames_node = vars_node,
...          obs_dfs = [obs1, obs2],
...          dataset_names=dataset_names,
...          )
